channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves Jamaica devastated. And, the shutdown's impact on airports
item.description: Officials are assessing the damage after Hurricane Melissa made landfall in Jamaica as a Category 5. And, how the government shutdown is impacting air...

item.title: ‘Not Very Much Survives a Category 5,’ and the Use of Tear Gas in Chicago
item.description: Plus, the website reshaping live music.

item.title: A Nazi Tattoo Exposes Democrats’ Greatest Weakness
item.description: Do Democrats know what the working class actually looks like?

item.title: Israeli Strikes in Gaza Kill at Least 100, Local Health Officials Say
item.description: Israel said the cease-fire had resumed after what appeared to be the deadliest day since the truce deal was agreed this month.

item.title: A River Restoration in Oregon Gets Fast Results: The Salmon Swam Right Back
item.description: The fish had been missing from the headwaters of the Klamath River for more than a century. Just a year after the removal of a final dam, they’ve retu...

item.title: Trump says he's confident of a deal ahead of Xi meeting
item.description: President Trump has confidently predicted striking a deal with China's leader, who he's set to meet Thursday.

item.title: An Alzheimer's pill appears to protect some in a high-risk population
item.description: A new study is reviving hope that a twice-daily pill can slow down Alzheimer's in people whose genes put them at high risk for the disease.

item.title: This furloughed IRS lawyer is living out his dream of being a hot dog vendor
item.description: While on furlough, Isaac Stein is fulfilling a childhood dream and passion project as a hot dog vendor.

item.title: Love or hate chain restaurants? We want to hear your story
item.description: America loves chain restaurants. NPR reporters Alana Wise and Jaclyn Diaz explore why.

item.title: When Caregiving Makes Women Ill
item.description: Eastern Europeans have migrated in droves to take care of Italy’s aged and infirm. Then they started getting sick, with an ailment dubbed ‘Italy syndr...

item.title: Israeli Strikes in Gaza Kill at Least 100, Local Health Officials Say
item.description: Israel said the cease-fire had resumed after what appeared to be the deadliest day since the truce deal was agreed this month.

item.title: Japan Plans to Send Troops to Help Stop Bear Attacks
item.description: With the number of people killed by bears reaching a record nationwide, the defense ministry is preparing to send the military to one badly hit area t...

item.title: Live Updates: Hurricane Melissa Makes Landfall in Cuba After Lashing Jamaica
item.description: The storm caused widespread damage in Jamaica to infrastructure and cut internet access for most people. Cuba evacuated about 750,000 people ahead of ...

item.title: Mercedes Reports a Drop in Profit but Maintains Forecast
item.description: The German carmaker held its outlook steady and said it would buy back more than $2 billion in shares, as sales of its high-end models improved.

item.title: Vietnam Prevents BBC Journalist From Leaving the Country
item.description: The reporter’s passport has been held by the authorities since August. Rights advocates want British officials to raise the issue with Vietnam’s visit...
